content: the same stich fo = fasten_off and cut yarn magic_ring = magic_ring r = round # single_crochet = single_crochet scinc = single_crochet increase 2 single_crochet in the same stitch stsc = standing single_crochet ssc = stacked single_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch yo = yarn over = stitch pattern to be repeated or stitches that are grouped = stitch count at end of round rules for this blanket *the work is turned at the end of every round unless otherwise specified **each round is started with a stacked single_crochet unless otherwise specified ***every decrease begins in a chain space after round 2 ****the first half of the decrease after a corner starts in the corner chain 3 space blanket pattern with colour a using a 6 5 or 7 0 mm crochet hook make a magic_ring r1 ssc for the first stitch then 7 double_crochet into the magic_ring tight up the magic_ring slip_stitch into the first stitch to close the circle do not turn 8 double_crochet r2 start with a ssc but do not yo and pull through last 2 loops on the hook in the same stitch make a double_crochet but pull through all 3 loops on the hook to make a decrease c3 decrease in the next double_crochet c1 decrease in next double_crochet c3 decrease in the next double_crochet c1 decrease in the next double_crochet c3 decrease in the next double_crochet c1 decrease in the next double_crochet c2 decrease in the final double_crochet c1 slip_stitch to first stitch 8 dc3tog r3-5 start with a ssc but do not yo and pull through last 2 loops on the hook in the same stitch make a double_crochet but pull through all 3 loops on the hook to make a decrease c1 decrease c3 decrease in c3 space decrease c1 across to next c3 corner decrease c3 decrease in c3 space decrease c1 across to next c3 space decrease c3 decrease in c3 space decrease c1 across to next c3 corner decrease c3 decrease in c3 space decrease c1 across to beginning of round slip_stitch to close round fo at the end of r5 32 decrease or 8 decrease per side note every round is the same as rounds 3-5 please note which rounds require a colour change otherwise continue in this same pattern until the blanket measures 40 x40 101 6cm x 101 6 cm or your desired size r6 colour c 40 decrease or 10 decrease per side r7-10 colour b 72 decrease or 18 decrease per side at the end of r10 r11 colour c 80 decrease or 20 decrease per side r12-15 colour a 112 decrease or 28 decrease per side at the end of r15 r16 colour c 120 decrease or 30 decrease per side r17-20 colour b 152 decrease or 38 decrease per side at the end of r20 r21 colour c 160 decrease or 40 decrease per side r22-25 colour a 192 decrease or 48 decrease per side at the end of r25 r26 colour c
